meanings.definition: A small lump or clot, especially of earth or clay.
meanings.sent1: I found a dod of clay in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The children made little dods of mud to throw at each other.
meanings.sent3: The dod of earth stuck to my shoe and made me trip.
meanings.sent4: The dod of clay resembled a tiny mountain in the sandbox.
meanings.sent5: She collected dods of clay to create miniature sculptures.

meanings.sent1: He tried to dod the question by changing the topic.
meanings.sent2: The cat managed to dod the dog by sneaking through the back door.
meanings.sent3: She always tries to dod doing her chores by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to dod the scandal, but the truth eventually came out.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox knew how to dod the traps set by the farmers.
